Brace your career – you’re going beyond the science quo with Spectrum. We’re the full-service, health and science communications and media agency that’s out of this world. We’re fiercely independent and 100% science-focused so we can go where other “science-light” agencies can’t or won’t. Together with superhuman strategy, atomic creative, intermedia magic, interwoven ingenuity and indomitable innovation we dream beyond the realm of the possible – and do it.Our Director works closely with the broader Strategy and Innovation teams to develop and implement measurement strategies and generate data-driven, proprietary insights to better achieve and measure our goals. You will inform and oversee the development of reports that synthesize results across channels and tactics to identify strategic insights and highlight areas for optimization. You will use your expertise in generating and analyzing data to guide a team of analysts in making insightful connections that are understandable and meaningful to our teams and our clients. You are a strong communicator who works well with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders and who can deftly navigate many different projects at once.Job ResponsibilitiesEnsure successful execution of analytics projects across assigned clients, while cultivating strong relationships internally and externallyManage & coordinate with multiple analysts and subject-matter experts simultaneously, overseeing collection and analysis of relevant data, analytics reports, presentations to clients and ensuring established processes are followed to deliver results that meet the highest quality standardsIdentify opportunities for custom offerings depending on client needs in order to deliver the most targeted and actionable insightsAct as a true strategic partner to drive relationship building and networking across the agency to uncover business opportunitiesDevelop strategic methodologies to collect and analyze data, leading to new insights and recommendations tailored to clients’ goalsEnsure information and resources flow properly with internal stakeholders on client accountsDesired Skills And QualificationsA Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Data Management, Statistics, Mathematics, or related majorAt least 7 years of agency or client-side digital/traditional analytics experience, healthcare experience strongly preferredStrong working knowledge of the digital landscape, including social media, search, paid, and earned media tacticsHands on experience overseeing strategic, program, tactical and measurement planning, analysis and insights (full funnel), including extensive experience in digital analytics and data visualization and familiarity with predictive modeling and statistical analysisExperience with analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics preferredKnowledge of data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio or Tableau a plusDemonstrated success in helping clients take concrete actions based on analytics and dataCreative thinker who is willing to think outside of the box and consistently look for opportunities to improve current capabilities and processesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsHighly self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as part of a teamDemonstrated success managing and motivating teamsYou choose where you work. We are a hybrid work environment with options to work in one of our four offices (DC, NYC, Chicago and Atlanta), remotely anywhere in the United States, or a combination.Spectrum is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Powered by JazzHRgcz30IcbAH
